summary:
Turkic languages are a group of over 35 languages spoken across Eurasia by Turkic people. They originated in East Asia and spread west. These languages have unique features like vowel harmony and no grammatical gender. The most spoken Turkic language is Turkish.

Some linguists believe Turkic languages are related to Mongolic and other Asian languages, but this is not widely accepted. Instead, their similarities are now thought to come from past language interactions.
title: Turkic languages
